original: sems can thams cad la bde ba phul du byung ba bskyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir byams pa'i sems @48a * //üîΩkyang bstan to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bde ba phul du byung ba bskyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir byams pa'i sems @48a * // kyang bstan to //
translated: And they are said to have a loving mind, because they have a mind that generates the highest bliss in all sentient beings.

original: stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir kun mkhyen 'dod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i phyir kun mkhyen 'dod do //
translated: They are said to desire omniscience, because they abide in emptiness.

original: chos cung zad kyang dmigs pa med pas rtag tu bstan pa la gzhol sems ldan no //
analyzed: chos cung zad kyang dmigs pa med pas rtag tu bstan pa la gzhol sems ldan no //
translated: They are said to have a mind that always strives for the teachings, because they do not apprehend any phenomenon at all.üîΩThey are said to be born in a central country, because they obtain birth in a central country where they can obtain the seven riches of faith, etc.

original: rang 'dod pa'i skye ba der skye ba thob pas mtha' 'khob kla klo'i skye bo'i yul mtha' rnam par spangs /üîΩrnam par spangs kyi sgra phyi ma dang yang 'brel pa'i phyir yul mtha' rnam par spangs te yul mtha'o //
analyzed: rang 'dod pa'i skye ba der skye ba thob pas mtha' 'khob kla klo'i skye bo'i yul mtha' rnam par spangs / rnam par spangs kyi sgra phyi ma dang yang 'brel pa'i phyir yul mtha' rnam par spangs te yul mtha'o //
translated: They are said to be born in a country that is not a border region, because they are born in a country that is not a border region where the barbarians live.

original: mngon par yid ches pas nges pa skyed pa'i phyir kun mkhyen gsum gyi bdag nyid ni rang gi sa la the tshom med pas na dogs med de /
analyzed: mngon par yid ches pas nges pa skyed pa'i phyir kun mkhyen gsum gyi bdag nyid ni rang gi sa la the tshom med pas na dogs med de /
translated: They are said to be fearless, because they generate certainty through their faith in the three omniscient ones, and they are fearless on their own stage because they have no doubts.

original: nges pa'i rang bzhin la gnas pas rtag tu ri rab 'dra'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i rang bzhin la gnas pas rtag tu ri rab 'dra'o //
translated: They are said to be like Mount Meru, because they always abide in certainty.

original: mchog tu gzhol pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi phyir bsams nas gtong pa ni srog kyang 'dor zhing ngo //
analyzed: mchog tu gzhol pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi phyir bsams nas gtong pa ni srog kyang 'dor zhing ngo //
translated: The supreme orientation is the giving of gifts after reflection for the sake of the Dharma, such as omniscience, even at the risk of one's life.

original: tshad ma dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rab tu brtson no //
analyzed: tshad ma dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rab tu brtson no //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ is very diligent because of the attention endowed with valid knowledge.

original: 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i phyogs tsam zhig brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i phyogs tsam zhig brjod do //
translated: Here, only a portion of the irreversible is mentioned.

original: de yang rgyu tshogs pa yis 'bras skye bar //
analyzed: de yang rgyu tshogs pa yis 'bras skye bar //
translated: Moreover, the effect is produced by the assemblage of causes.

original: rjes su dpogs pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: rjes su dpogs pa gang yin pa //
translated: That which is inferred

original: don gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: don gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
translated: is not dependent on another object.

original: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be intrinsic nature.

original: ces bya ba'i rigs pas 'dir bstan pa'i rtags kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rigs pas 'dir bstan pa'i rtags kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: By this reasoning, the reason taught here should be understood.

original: yon tan rin po che sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam pa'i le'u ste bcu bdun pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: yon tan rin po che sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam pa'i le'u ste bcu bdun pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the seventeenth chapter, having sixteen verses, called ‚Äúthe perfection of the irreversible stage.‚Äù

original: // / de ltar bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa na khyad par ma rtogs khyad par gzhan rtogs par mi 'gyur bas na rigs pa 'dis bsgom pa'i lam las re zhig khyad par bstan pa'i phyir gzugs dang zhes bya ba laüîΩsogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // / de ltar bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ston pa na khyad par ma rtogs khyad par gzhan rtogs par mi 'gyur bas na rigs pa 'dis bsgom pa'i lam las re zhig khyad par bstan pa'i phyir gzugs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, in the context of teaching the characteristics of the irreversible one who abides on the path of cultivation, since one who has not realized the distinction will not realize another distinction, by this reasoning, in order to teach the distinction from the path of cultivation, [the Lord] declares, ‚Äúform, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar de bzhin nyid zab pa de bzhin du de kho na nyid du gzugs ma skyes pas zab bo //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin nyid zab pa de bzhin du de kho na nyid du gzugs ma skyes pas zab bo //
translated: Just as suchness is profound, so form is profound in reality because of the non-arising of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyang de bzhin nyid 'dis zab pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams kyang de bzhin nyid 'dis zab pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are profound by this suchness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs par med de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs par med de /
translated: Form, etc. are not form, etc.

original: sgro btags pa'i phyir med do //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i phyir med do //
translated: because of the superimposition of what is not.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag kyang tha mal pa'i rang bzhin rigs pas mtshan ma ma lus pa spangs pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun rdzob pa'i gzugs la sogs pa de dag kyang tha mal pa'i rang bzhin rigs pas mtshan ma ma lus pa spangs pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, those conventional forms, etc. are also signless because of the abandonment of all signs by reasoning of the nature of the ordinary.

original: bslab pa thams cad zhi bas na rab zhi ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pa thams cad zhi bas na rab zhi ba'o //
translated: Since all the trainings are pacified, it is well pacified.

original: 'dis @48b ni yang gzugs la sogs pa de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pas skur pa 'debs pa dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis @48b ni yang gzugs la sogs pa de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin pas skur pa 'debs pa dgag pa yin no //

analyzed: dper na 'ba' zhig tshad ma rtogs pa mnga' 'phangs pa rgya mtsho'i gting la thug pa'i tshad tshol ba ltar /

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyis ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba nges par brtags na gang gi phyir brtags pas gting yod pa mi rnyed pas zab mo dang ldan pa ni zab pa ste /

translated: in the same way, when one examines with wisdom, free from the extremes of superimposition and denial, since one does not find any depth through examination, it is profound,

original: bsgom pa'i lam yin zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yin zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is taught that it is the path of cultivation.

original: khyad par bstan pa 'di nyid rjes su bstan pa dang bcas pa khyad par can bsgom pa'i lam yin par ston pa na de'i byed pa'i sgo nas dris pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par bstan pa 'di nyid rjes su bstan pa dang bcas pa khyad par can bsgom pa'i lam yin par ston pa na de'i byed pa'i sgo nas dris pa ni /

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the bodhisattva‚Äôs cultivation of the path of cultivation?‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyi de kho na nyid du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched yod pa yin par yang dang yang du goms par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig gi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi chos dang gang zag gi bdag med pa mngon sum du byas pas de ltar zab par gyur pa ni theg pa
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyi de kho na nyid du phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched yod pa yin par yang dang yang du goms par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig gi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi chos dang gang zag gi bdag med pa mngon sum du byas pas de ltar zab par gyur pa ni theg pa
translated: Because the bodhisattva who has repeatedly familiarized himself with the fact that the aggregates, elements, and sense bases exist in the reality of the path of cultivation, by directly realizing the selflessness of phenomena and persons of all phenomena such as form, etc., in that way, that profound vehicle

original: chen por don dam par dmigs pas gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chen por don dam par dmigs pas gos pa med pa'o //

original: gang zag de'i bsod nams kyi tshogs de ji snyed skye ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu thob pa na yang dag par 'grub pa de las ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes bya bar tshigs su bcad pa'i don sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang zag de'i bsod nams kyi tshogs de ji snyed skye ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu thob pa na yang dag par 'grub pa de las ci zhig yod par 'gyur zhes bya bar tshigs su bcad pa'i don sbyar ro //
translated: Whatever that person's accumulation of merit arises, when the accumulation of wisdom is attained, what could exist from that accomplishment? Thus the meaning of the verse is applied.

original: 'bras bu gsal bar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gsal bar rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: dper na yul dman pa la lhag par chags pa'i phyir 'dod chags chos la spyod pa'i skyes bu zhig /

analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig tu khyod che ge mor shog shig ces smras nas dus btab de dang ma phrad de /

original: dmigs pa la bsgribs nas nyin zhag thams cad du byung ba'i skyes bu'i rnam par rtog pa'i grangs de snyed kyi bskal par rgyun mi 'chad par 'gro ba 'khor bar 'gyur ba dor nas ji snyed kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis byang chub 'thob pa
analyzed: dmigs pa la bsgribs nas nyin zhag thams cad du byung ba'i skyes bu'i rnam par rtog pa'i grangs de snyed kyi bskal par rgyun mi 'chad par 'gro ba 'khor bar 'gyur ba dor nas ji snyed kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis byang chub 'thob pa
translated: The merit and wisdom accumulations that are needed to attain enlightenment are equal to the number of thoughts that arise in a person‚Äôs mind in the course of a day.

analyzed: de snyed kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsgom pa'i lam gyi mthus byang @49a * //

original: chub sems dpa' thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the bodhisattva attains the path of meditation.

original: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yangs pa'i rnam pa'i dbye bas bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yangs pa'i rnam pa'i dbye bas bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'dir bsdus nas brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir bsdus nas bstan par bya ste /

original: de la yang lam chung dus ni rnam par rtog pa chen po spong la /
analyzed: de la yang lam chung dus ni rnam par rtog pa chen po spong la /

analyzed: chen pos ni rnam par rtog pa chung du spong ngo zhes bya bar gzung ste /

original: de lta bu lam chen po la mi srid de /
analyzed: de lta bu lam chen po la mi srid de /

original: yang lam chen po skyes pa na nyon mongs pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan dag na re phyi ma phyi ma la bsod nams lhag par sgrub pa ni gnyen po'i dbye ba yin la /
analyzed: yang lam chen po skyes pa na nyon mongs pa chen po med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan dag na re phyi ma phyi ma la bsod nams lhag par sgrub pa ni gnyen po'i dbye ba yin la /

analyzed: bsod nams zil gyis gnon par bstan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbye ba bstan pa yin no zhes zer ro //

original: lam chung du bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: lam chung ngu'i rang bzhin bsgom pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: Even though he gives to the arhats and pratyekabuddhas, and protects morality, another son of the Victor, endowed with the meditation of the nature of the small path,

original: gnas skabs de bzhin no //

original: lam 'bring gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam 'bring gi don bstan pa'i phyir /

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab mchog ste /

original: lam 'bring gi rang bzhin bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: lam 'bring gi rang bzhin bsgom pa ste /

analyzed: chos de yang 'gro ba mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs par 'thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don te /

original: lam chen po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam chen po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the great path,üîΩhe says,

analyzed: bsod nams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The merit of all of that is said to be ‚Äúempty‚Äù and so forth.

analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i lam bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsod nams de dag thams cad kyang gsog dang ste /

analyzed: yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'brel pa la skye ba'i phyir ya ma brla'o //

analyzed: rgyu ma'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir snying po med par shes pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar bde gshegs rnams kyi shes rab spyad spyod pa de ni lam chen po'i rang bzhin yin te /

translated: Because it was just taught, the bodhisattvas who practice the meditation on the equality of samsara and nirvana through realizing the characteristics of irreversibility think like this: I, having been predicted by the Ten Powered One, will attain the supreme enlightenment, and having attained it, I will liberate sentient beings who are not liberated and deliver those not delivered.

original: reg 'gyur rlom sems med do //

original: gang gi tshe ji skad bstan pa'i rtags la spyod pa de'i tshe de ltar spyod pa bde gshegs shes rab spyod pa yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ji skad bstan pa'i rtags la spyod pa de'i tshe de ltar spyod pa bde gshegs shes rab spyod pa yin /
translated: then one who practices the signs as they have been taught practices the wisdom of the sugatas.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rtags kyi rang bzhin rnams dang / chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid yin na ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rtags kyi rang bzhin rnams dang / chos rnams thams cad stong pa nyid yin na ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar gzhag ce na /
translated: If the nature of the reasons as taught and all phenomena are emptiness, how can the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified be posited?

original: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩbdag dang bdag gir zhen pas kham gyi zas la sogs pa 'dod byed cing /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / bdag dang bdag gir zhen pas kham gyi zas la sogs pa 'dod byed cing /
translated: The response to that is: Sentient beings... and so on.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i sems can du yongs su rdog pas 'khor ba sgrub pa dang / srung ba mi zad pa'i skye bo phyin ci log la chags pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pas des skye bo srung ba rtag tu 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i sems can du yongs su rdog pas 'khor ba sgrub pa dang / srung ba mi zad pa'i skye bo phyin ci log la chags pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pas des skye bo srung ba rtag tu 'khor ro //
translated: By clinging to self and mine, they desire food by the mouthful and so on, and by fully grasping sentient beings of the desire and form realms, they establish and protect cyclic existence. The people who protect that are always circling with the attention of attachment to error.

original: yang de kho na nyid du bdag dang bdag gi la sogs pa'i chos nyid gnyis ma skyes pa'i phyir yang dag min te stong pa'o //
analyzed: yang de kho na nyid du bdag dang bdag gi la sogs pa'i chos nyid gnyis ma skyes pa'i phyir yang dag min te stong pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in reality, the two natures of self, mine, and so on are not produced, so they are not real and are empty.

original: phyin ci log gi stobs kyis nam mkha' la mdud pa bor ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi stobs kyis nam mkha' la mdud pa bor ro //
translated: By the power of error, knots are tied in space.

original: de bzhin du skye bo rnams rang nyid bcings pa ste grol bar dka' zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye bo rnams rang nyid bcings pa ste grol bar dka' zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: In the same way, people are bound, that is, difficult to liberate.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tha snyad la mi mkhas pa'i phyir byis pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad la mi mkhas pa'i phyir byis pa ste /
translated: Because they are unskilled in conventional usage, they are fools.

original: byis pa bzhin grol bar mi nus zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: byis pa bzhin grol bar mi nus zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: They are not able to be liberated like a fool.

original: des ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: des ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is the presentation of the things of affliction.

original: ci 'di dag phyin ci log gi stobs kyis kun du ston par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci 'di dag phyin ci log gi stobs kyis kun du ston par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Are they presented as being displayed by the power of error?

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, for example,

original: dper na dug med pa la phyin ci log gi stobs kyis dug tu shes pa nyid kyis dug langs te mi la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: dper na dug med pa la phyin ci log gi stobs kyis dug tu shes pa nyid kyis dug langs te mi la khyab pa'o //
translated: For example, by the power of error, one who is without poison thinks, ‚ÄúI have poison,‚Äù and spreads it on his body.

original: dug de khong du song ba med kyang brgyal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dug de khong du song ba med kyang brgyal bar 'gyur /
translated: Even though that poison has not entered his stomach, he faints.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes @58b pa'i phyir yang byis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes @58b pa'i phyir yang byis pa'o //
translated: In the same way, because the noble path has not arisen, one is a fool.

original: phyin ci log gi stobs kyis legs par sbyar te /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi stobs kyis legs par sbyar te /
translated: By the power of error, one is well prepared.

original: 'di ni bdag go //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag go //
translated: This is the self.

original: 'di ni bdag gi chos so snyam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi chos so snyam mo //
translated: I think, This is my Dharma.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is also said:

original: bdag yod pa ni gzhan du shes //
analyzed: bdag yod pa ni gzhan du shes //
translated: When there is a self, one knows of another.üîΩFrom the division of self and other, there is grasping and hatred.

original: bdag gzhan cha las 'dzin dang sdang // de gnyis dang ni 'brel pa las //
analyzed: bdag gzhan cha las 'dzin dang sdang // de gnyis dang ni 'brel pa las //
translated: From the connection with these two,

original: nyes pa ma lus 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa ma lus 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: all faults arise.

original: de ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa skyes pa des kyang de dag nyid du dben zhing stong pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa la byis pas sgro btags so //
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu 'du shes pa skyes pa des kyang de dag nyid du dben zhing stong pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa la byis pas sgro btags so //
translated: Thus, the conception of self arises, and the childish superimpose what is unreal upon those very things because they are isolated and empty.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i nus pa las bzlog pa ni rnam par byang ba'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go ;
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i nus pa las bzlog pa ni rnam par byang ba'i dngos por rnam par gzhag go ;
translated: The opposite of the capacity as it has been taught is posited as the reality of purification.

original: / bden pa gnyis la yang dag par brten nas gnyi ga rnam par gzhag pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / bden pa gnyis la yang dag par brten nas gnyi ga rnam par gzhag pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir /

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said:üîΩAs for the way in which there is grasping,

original: ji ltar 'dzin pa ste mngon par zhen pa ni kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzin pa ste mngon par zhen pa ni kun rdzob bo //

original: ji ltar mi dmigs pa de ltar rnam par byang bar gsungs /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs pa de ltar rnam par byang bar gsungs /

original: de kho na nyid du 'di la gang yang ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du 'di la gang yang ste /
translated: In reality, there is nothing here,

original: sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log med pas gang zhig nyon mongs rnam dag 'gyur med pa //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log med pas gang zhig nyon mongs rnam dag 'gyur med pa //

original: byang chub sems dpas shes rab pha rol phyin pa rtogs //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas shes rab pha rol phyin pa rtogs //
translated: The bodhisattva realizes the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the verse is ‚Äúthe reality of phenomena.‚Äù

analyzed: nas sngar bstan pa'i sems can de dag gi sbyin pa'i phung pos bsod nams kyi rgyu'i char yang phod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and if another were to dedicate to full enlightenment the gift of the Dharma that is taught by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas for many hundreds of thousands of millions of eons,üîΩand if another were to dedicate to full enlightenment the

original: de'i phyir g-yel ba med par rtag tu shes rab 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yel ba med par rtag tu shes rab 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should always engage in wisdom without interruption.

original: bsgom par bya zhes lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes lhag ma'o //
translated: One should cultivate it, the remainder.

original: yul 'di 'ba' zhig la goms par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: yul 'di 'ba' zhig la goms par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: This is not the only object to be cultivated.

analyzed: 'on kyang snying rje yang goms par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: However, in order to demonstrate that one should also cultivate compassion, it is said, ‚Äúwisdom,‚Äù etc.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin mchog spyod pa ji ltar bstan pa'i rang bzhin la mnyam par 'jog pa'i tshe rgyal ba'i sras de ni rnal 'byor pa'o //

translated: When the nature of the practice of the perfection of wisdom as taught is settled in equipoise, then the son of the Victor is a yogi.

original: snying rje chen po bskyed kyang sems can 'du shes med de /
analyzed: snying rje chen po bskyed kyang sems can 'du shes med de /
translated: Even though he generates great compassion, he does not have the notion of sentient beings.

original: mngon par zhen pas sems can du 'du shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pas sems can du 'du shes par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not have the notion of sentient beings due to adherence.

original: de'i tshe rtags sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis na mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtags sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis na mkhas pa'o //
translated: At that time, he is a scholar because he is preceded by the signs.

original: 'gro ba kun gyi bsod nams kyi zhing yin pa'i phyir sbyin gnas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba kun gyi bsod nams kyi zhing yin pa'i phyir sbyin gnas 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes a recipient of gifts because he is a field of merit for all beings.

original: dus rtag tu gdon mi za bar thob pa'i 'bras bu ster ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yul 'khor bsod snyoms don yod yongs su spyod do //
analyzed: dus rtag tu gdon mi za bar thob pa'i 'bras bu ster ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir yul 'khor bsod snyoms don yod yongs su spyod do //
translated: He always enjoys the alms of the world, which are the object, with the power to grant the fruit that is to be attained without fail.

original: de bas na sems can gyi don gyi rab snying rje dang shes rab gnyis kyi rnal 'byor sgrub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi don gyi rab snying rje dang shes rab gnyis kyi rnal 'byor sgrub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the practice of the yoga of compassion and wisdom, which is the best for the sake of sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva, etc.‚Äù

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig 'dir rang gi phyin ci log gi stobs kyis dus yun ring por bcing ba'i lha mi ngan song gsum ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who, here, by the power of his error, is bound for a long time to the three realms of gods, humans, and the unfortunate destinies, i.e., the hells, etc.,

original: dgrol bar yang dag par 'dod pas lam yangs ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: dgrol bar yang dag par 'dod pas lam yangs ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: and who truly desires to liberate them, by the path of the Great Vehicle,

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol gyi 'gram sems can gyi khams la ston par 'dod pas zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol gyi 'gram sems can gyi khams la ston par 'dod pas zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
translated: and who desires to show the other shore of the ocean of cyclic existence to the realm of sentient beings, as before.

original: de bas na nyin mtshan du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa snying rje dang bcas pa 'di la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyin mtshan du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa snying rje dang bcas pa 'di la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should strive in this perfection of wisdom together with compassion day and night.

original: don de nyid kho na zhes dpes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid kho na zhes dpes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to illuminate just that meaning with an example,üîΩhe says,

original: mi zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩdper na mi zhig sngon chad ma rnyed pa'i rin chen mchog ste /
analyzed: mi zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dper na mi zhig sngon chad ma rnyed pa'i rin chen mchog ste /
translated: For example, a certain man, etc.üîΩFor example, a certain man, having obtained a supreme jewel which he had not obtained before,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i dus gzhan zhig rnyed par gyur te dga' ba las /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i dus gzhan zhig rnyed par gyur te dga' ba las /
translated: through delight,

original: de ma thag tu yang rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa'i spyod pas bag med par gyur te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu yang rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa'i spyod pas bag med par gyur te /
translated: immediately becomes heedless through the conduct of distraction, etc.

original: rnyed pa stor na ni de la stor bar mi 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i yid la byed pas rin chen 'dod pas rtag tu sdug @59b bsngal lo //
analyzed: rnyed pa stor na ni de la stor bar mi 'dod pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i yid la byed pas rin chen 'dod pas rtag tu sdug @59b bsngal lo //
translated: If he loses the jewel, he is constantly miserable through the mental activity of not wanting to lose it and of longing for the thing that is gone.

original: de ltar de bzhin du byang chub mchog zhugs rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir rin po che dang 'dra ba'i snying rje dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin du byang chub mchog zhugs rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir rin po che dang 'dra ba'i snying rje dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva who has set out for supreme enlightenment should not give up the practice of the perfection of wisdom, which is like a jewel, because it is difficult to obtain.

original: rin chen dor ba rnyed pa ltar //
analyzed: rin chen dor ba rnyed pa ltar //
translated: Just as one would not give up a jewel,

original: 'di ltar gos la sogs pa la gtums nas rab tu brtson pas sems can 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar gos la sogs pa la gtums nas rab tu brtson pas sems can 'dzin to //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, having wrapped it in cloth, etc., holds it with great effort.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dus yun ring por goms pa dang rjes su 'brel ba de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' myur ba nyid du yang dag pa'i lam du zhugs pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //

translated: When the perfection of wisdom is practiced for a long time and is well-integrated, then the bodhisattva quickly enters the true path and attains nirvana.

analyzed: yon tan rin po che sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi le'u ste nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the chapter on the spiritual teacher, the twenty-second chapter in the Treatise on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle.

original: // / snying rje dang shes rab dag gis rnam par 'phel ba thun mong gi 'bras bu bstan nas /
analyzed: // / snying rje dang shes rab dag gis rnam par 'phel ba thun mong gi 'bras bu bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the common result of the increase of compassion and wisdom,

original: khyad par gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩdpe sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: khyad par gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir / dpe sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: now, in order to realize the special result of overcoming the opposing factors,üîΩhe gives an example.

original: nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The sun, etc.

original: dper na nyi ma sprin dang bral bas gsal bar 'char ba'i 'od zer dra ba can //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma sprin dang bral bas gsal bar 'char ba'i 'od zer dra ba can //
translated: For example, the sun, free from clouds, rising clearly, its rays in a net,

analyzed: mun nag thibs po'i mun pa thams cad 'joms 'char ba //
translated: destroys all the thick darkness of the night,üîΩand with its own light it outshines all the fireflies, all the creatures, all the hosts of stars such as Venus, Jupiter, etc., and the light of the moon.

original: rang gi 'od kyis 'phro ba srin bu me khyer srog chags 'byung po thams cad dang / pa ba sangs dang / phur bu la sogs pa'i skar ma'i tshogs dang zla ba'i 'od kun zil gyis gnon pa de bzhin du ji skad bshad pa'i shes rab kyis rang bzhin shes rab pha rol phyin mchog spyod /

translated: Whoever trains in that way, in order to obtain benefit and abandon what is not beneficial, trains in this Dharma, which is the ten virtues and so forth that cause the attainment of buddhahood, and is excellent.

original: @61b de nyid tshul khrims 'chal ba dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @61b de nyid tshul khrims 'chal ba dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas mnyes par byed pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares, ‚Äúawakening,‚Äù and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig de lta bu'i bden pa gnyis kyi rim pa las ma 'das par bstan ma thag pa'i bslab pa 'di shes pa de ni gzhan yang sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ma tshang ba med pas bslab nyams tshul khrims 'chal mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig de lta bu'i bden pa gnyis kyi rim pa las ma 'das par bstan ma thag pa'i bslab pa 'di shes pa de ni gzhan yang sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ma tshang ba med pas bslab nyams tshul khrims 'chal mi 'gyur /
translated: That bodhisattva who knows this training, which has just been taught without transgressing the sequence of the two truths in that way, is also not incomplete in perfect practice, and therefore does not degenerate in training and does not become immoral.

original: de ni sangs rgyas chos mnyes bya phyir 'di ni 'di la slob po //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas chos mnyes bya phyir 'di ni 'di la slob po //
translated: He trains in this in order to please the Buddha‚Äôs Dharma.

original: bden pa gnyis la brten nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du slob pa ni bslab lhag bslab la mkhas te dngos por dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la brten nas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du slob pa ni bslab lhag bslab la mkhas te dngos por dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The skill in the higher training in the two realities is the non-apprehension of the higher training, because it is free from the apprehension of an entity.

original: de nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gang yin zhe na /

original: mkhas pa 'od byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa 'od byed ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: mkhas pa ni shes rab can te /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni shes rab can te /

original: bden pa gnyis la brten nas ye shes kyi 'od mnga' ba'i phyir 'od byed do //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la brten nas ye shes kyi 'od mnga' ba'i phyir 'od byed do //

original: dge ba ma yin sems gcig tsam yang skyed mi byed /
analyzed: dge ba ma yin sems gcig tsam yang skyed mi byed /

original: nye ma mkha' la 'gro ba'i ste /
analyzed: nye ma mkha' la 'gro ba'i ste /

original: bar snang la 'od zer brgya phrag bkye bas /
analyzed: bar snang la 'od zer brgya phrag bkye bas /

original: mdun gyi bar snang la ni mun pa mi ga nas bzhin /
analyzed: mdun gyi bar snang la ni mun pa mi ga nas bzhin /

original: de bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i bslab pa la slob pas yon tan skyed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i bslab pa la slob pas yon tan skyed do zhes bya bar dgongs so //

analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bslab par bya ba gzhan dag yod pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na la slob par bstan zhe na /

analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na la bslab par byas pa rnams kyi chos thams cad khong du chud pa'i rnal 'byor legs par sbyangs pas rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyis 'khor dang bcas pa la bslabs pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa lhag
translated: The victors‚Äô sons, who have trained in the perfection of wisdom alone, have trained in all the perfections, along with their attendant factors, because they have well trained in the yoga of understanding all phenomena.

original: ma thams cad 'dir ni 'dus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma thams cad 'dir ni 'dus par 'gyur te /

original: tshangs pa'i dra bas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dra bas zhus pa'i mdo las /

analyzed: ji ltar 'jig tshogs la lta bar lta ba drug cu gnyis 'dus par bstan te /

original: des bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'di dag 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa la goms par byas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dus par 'gyur ro //

translated: In the same way, the perfection of generosity, etc., are included in the perfection of wisdom, because they are cultivated in the context of the purity of the three spheres.

analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i sgo nas bstan nas ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /

original: dper na zhes bya ba @62a * //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba @62a * //

original: la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cessation of the collection of the city of the faculties, which is the extent of the faculties, occurs because there is no basis.üîΩThus, for the wise who practice wisdom, the bodhisattvas, the perfection of generosity and so on, all the perfections as they have been taught, are held by the power of that wisdom.

original: de ltar shes rab spyod pa mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' mchog rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad ni de'i stobs kyis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na thamsüîΩcad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab spyod pa mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' mchog rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad ni de'i stobs kyis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the perfection of wisdom does not exist, all the perfections do not exist.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na la bslab par ston to zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na la bslab par ston to zhes bya bar dgongs so //

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs pas thams cad bslabs pa yin na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs pas thams cad bslabs pa yin na /
translated: If it is the case that by training in the perfection of wisdom one trains in all the perfections,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: nyan thos kyi yon tan thob pa'i lam la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang / de bzhin du rang rgyal rnams kyi yon tan kun la byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa des 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don du slob par byed pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The wise bodhisattva trains for the sake of others, in order to guide sentient beings, in the paths that are the means for attaining the qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and likewise the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: yang de la mi gnas te /
analyzed: yang de la mi gnas te /

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa yang mi skyed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa yang mi skyed de /

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yon tan 'di ni gzhan gyi don du bslab bya yin snyam nas de'i phyir slob kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i yon tan 'di ni gzhan gyi don du bslab bya yin snyam nas de'i phyir slob kyi /
translated: He trains in those qualities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on for the sake of others, thinking, ‚ÄúThese are the trainings for the sake of others.‚Äù

analyzed: don de nyid mngon du byed pas skyon ma yin no //

analyzed: yon tan rin po che sdud pa tshigs su bcad pa las bslab pa'i le'u ste nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i bshad pa'o /

original: // / rnam par 'phel ba de lta bu'i 'phel ba'i brtan pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmi ldog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩgang gi tshe phyir mi ldog pa'i khyad par byang chub mchog la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig snying rje chen po sems can gyi don du sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la bsam pa thag pas yi rang ba de'i tshe stong gsum gyi
analyzed: // / rnam par 'phel ba de lta bu'i 'phel ba'i brtan pa bstan pa'i phyir / mi ldog ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gang gi tshe phyir mi ldog pa'i khyad par byang chub mchog la rab tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig snying rje chen po sems can gyi don du sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la bsam pa thag pas yi rang ba de'i tshe stong gsum gyi
translated: The steadfastness of such increase is taught in the following verse.

original: stong chen po'i ri rab srang la gzhal bas tshad gzung bar rung gi //
analyzed: stong chen po'i ri rab srang la gzhal bas tshad gzung bar rung gi //
translated: When the steadfast ones, the bodhisattvas, who are irreversible from the supreme enlightenment, rejoice with a pure intention in the generation of bodhichitta and so on, which is done out of great compassion for the sake of sentient beings, then the merit of their rejoicing is far greater than that of the offering of the billion worlds.

original: rgyal ba'i sras kyi dge ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i brtan pa'i tshad ni gzung bar mi nus te de lta yin no //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras kyi dge ba la rjes su yi rang ba'i brtan pa'i tshad ni gzung bar mi nus te de lta yin no //
translated: The merit of the offering of a billion worlds can be measured by weighing it against the merit of the rejoicing, but the merit of the rejoicing of the bodhisattvas, the children of the victorious ones, cannot be measured.

original: nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir chos gzhan dag la yang bstan pa'i tshad @62b nye bar gzung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir chos gzhan dag la yang bstan pa'i tshad @62b nye bar gzung bar mi nus so //
translated: Because it is an illustration, it cannot be taken as a measure of the teaching for other dharmas.

original: bstan pa de lta bus brtan pa'i sems gnas pa brjod par brtan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa de lta bus brtan pa'i sems gnas pa brjod par brtan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to express the stability of the mind that is supported by such a teaching,

original: dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe virtuous, etc.‚Äù

analyzed: tshogs kyi lam la sogs pa ni dge ba'i don gnyer ro //

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa ni phan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa ni phan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The Joyful, etc., are the aims of benefit.

original: sems can ji snyed pa kun gyi bsod nams phung po ji snyed pa la'ang yi rang 'gyur /
analyzed: sems can ji snyed pa kun gyi bsod nams phung po ji snyed pa la'ang yi rang 'gyur /
translated: He rejoices in the mass of merit of all sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir de dag bsod nams lhag pa'i rang bzhin sems brtan pa thob pas sems can gyi don du byang chub sems dpa' rim gyis rgyal ba'i yon tan rjes su thob par gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag bsod nams lhag pa'i rang bzhin sems brtan pa thob pas sems can gyi don du byang chub sems dpa' rim gyis rgyal ba'i yon tan rjes su thob par gyur nas /
translated: Therefore, by attaining the stable mind that has the nature of superior merit, the bodhisattva gradually attains the qualities of the Victor for the sake of sentient beings.

original: phyin ci log ma lus pa'i sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten te 'gro la chos sbyin byed /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma lus pa'i sdug bsngal zad par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten te 'gro la chos sbyin byed /
translated: In order to extinguish the suffering of all error, he gives the gift of Dharma to the world, to beings.

original: 'dir yang rtags la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang rtags la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i dro ba la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Here, the signs and so forth are, respectively, the nature of the four aspects of the penetrations, such as the heat of the realization of the peak.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i rjes la mthong ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i rjes la mthong ba'i lam yin te /
translated: After the aspects of penetration, there is the path of seeing,

original: de la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: and there are also four types of counteragents to that.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pas rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pas rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: They are the conceptualizations of subject and object.

original: yang 'di spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po dang blang bar bya ba yin pa la thams cad 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po spang bar bya ba bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: yang 'di spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po dang blang bar bya ba yin pa la thams cad 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po spang bar bya ba bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach the first conceptualization of the apprehended, which is the basis of the side that engages in all of those, and the antidote and what is to be adopted that abandons that,

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who is nonconceptual‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig mthong ba'i lam la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na ji skad bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig mthong ba'i lam la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs na ji skad bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the path of seeing, at the stage of application, is nonconceptual because he has abandoned the conceptualizations as they have been taught.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bral ba'i phyir chos rnams kun stong pa dang mtshan ma med pa yongs su shes pa dang / sgro btags pas chos thams cad dben pa'i phyir spros pa med pa de nyid yongs su shes pa de ni shes rab ji skad bstan pas rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rnam pas byang chub tshol bar mi byed do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bral ba'i phyir chos rnams kun stong pa dang mtshan ma med pa yongs su shes pa dang / sgro btags pas chos thams cad dben pa'i phyir spros pa med pa de nyid yongs su shes pa de ni shes rab ji skad bstan pas rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rnam pas byang chub tshol bar mi byed do //
translated: Because of the absence of cause and effect, all phenomena are empty and signless. Because of the absence of superimposition, all phenomena are isolated. The understanding of that very absence of conceptual elaboration is the perfection of wisdom.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba gang yin pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba gang yin pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That which is connected as cause and effect is endowed with consequence.

original: mthong ba'i lam yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The yogi is endowed with the mental activity of the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid ni shes rab pha rol phyin mchog go //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid ni shes rab pha rol phyin mchog go //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the nature of the path of seeing.

original: thams cad zlog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad zlog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can bzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The second conceptualization is the conceptualization of the object of apprehension, which is the basis of the position of the reversal of all.üîΩIn order to abandon that, it is said:

original: nam mkha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúSpace-like‚Äù and so on.

original: dper na nam mkha'i khams dang nam @63a * //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i khams dang nam @63a * //
translated: For example, it is like the element of space.üîΩ

original: mkha' lhan cig tu phan tshun spangs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: mkha' lhan cig tu phan tshun spangs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba med do //
translated: For example, the element of space and space are not contradictory in terms of mutual exclusion, etc.

original: gang gi nam mkha'i khams de dang ni nam mkha' der yul 'ga' zhig tu rnam pa 'gas 'gal ba thob pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang gi nam mkha'i khams de dang ni nam mkha' der yul 'ga' zhig tu rnam pa 'gas 'gal ba thob pa lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention that the element of space and space obtain contradiction in some place in some way?

original: gang gi sgras 'phangs pa'i brjod par bya ba ni rang la rang byed pa 'gal bas mi srid do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi sgras 'phangs pa'i brjod par bya ba ni rang la rang byed pa 'gal bas mi srid do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The expressed meaning implied by the word ‚Äúwhat‚Äù is that it is impossible for something to act on itself, because that is contradictory.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin shes rab spyod mkhas byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin shes rab spyod mkhas byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bu yin te /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva who is skilled in practicing the wisdom that is the nature of the path of seeing is like space because he has attained nonconceptual wisdom.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na ji skad bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas nye bar zhi ba spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na ji skad bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas nye bar zhi ba spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: When the mind and mental factors of the path of seeing are engaged, he practices peace, having abandoned the conceptions that were explained.

original: de bas na de nyid kyis gang dang yang lhan cig tu cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid kyis gang dang yang lhan cig tu cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, it is not at all contradictory for it to be in association with anything.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bstan nas /
