analyzed: grub pa phun sum tshogs pa ni kun gyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: The perfection of spiritual practice is the engagement in all.

original: sems can kun la phan phyir te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung ba'i ched du de yang yongs su sngo bar byed na de ni stobs bcu ldan pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan phyir te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung ba'i ched du de yang yongs su sngo bar byed na de ni stobs bcu ldan pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: If one dedicates that to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment for the sake of the welfare of all sentient beings, then one is said to possess the ten powers.

original: spyod yul ni ltung ba thams cad spangs pa'i phyir tshul khrims nyams pa med par gnas par gyur pa yin no zhes tshigs su bcad pa'i don sbyar ro //
analyzed: spyod yul ni ltung ba thams cad spangs pa'i phyir tshul khrims nyams pa med par gnas par gyur pa yin no zhes tshigs su bcad pa'i don sbyar ro //
translated: The domain is that, because of abandoning all downfalls, one abides without the decline of morality.

original: don de nyid ldog pa sngon du 'gro bas gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid ldog pa sngon du 'gro bas gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that very meaning by way of a negation,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te rang rgyal dang dgra bcom pa'i byang chub bzung nas sdom pa mnos pa yongs su sngo bar byed pa ni reg par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rang rgyal dang dgra bcom pa'i byang chub bzung nas sdom pa mnos pa yongs su sngo bar byed pa ni reg par 'dod pa'o //
translated: If, having taken up the vow of the pratyekabuddha and arhat enlightenment, one dedicates it, then one is desirous of contact.

original: de'i tshe theg pa chen po sgrub pa spangs pa'i phyir tshul khrims 'chal zhing ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe theg pa chen po sgrub pa spangs pa'i phyir tshul khrims 'chal zhing ngo //
translated: At that time, because of abandoning the practice of the Great Vehicle, one has corrupt morality.

original: mi mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The unwise one is the bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin du blangs pa'i sdom pa yongs su btang zhing bug pa dang bcas pas spyod pa ni nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du blangs pa'i sdom pa yongs su btang zhing bug pa dang bcas pas spyod pa ni nyams pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the practice is declined because of the abandonment of the vow that was taken and because of the holes.

original: ci ste byang chub zhi ba mchog tu blangs pa'i tshul khrims yongs su sngo bar byed na /
analyzed: ci ste byang chub zhi ba mchog tu blangs pa'i tshul khrims yongs su sngo bar byed na /
translated: But if one dedicates the morality that was taken to the supreme peace of enlightenment,

original: 'dod yon brtson yang tshul khrims dang 'gal ba med par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dod yon brtson yang tshul khrims dang 'gal ba med par bstan te /
translated: He shows that even though he strives for sense objects, he does not violate morality.

original: blangs pa'i don yongs su ma btang bas tshul khrims pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas so //
analyzed: blangs pa'i don yongs su ma btang bas tshul khrims pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas so //
translated: He abides in the perfection of morality because he does not give up the meaning of what he has taken up.

original: ci'i phyir tshul khrims kho na la dang por gdams she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshul khrims kho na la dang por gdams she na /
translated: Why is he instructed in morality first of all?

original: chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He states the reason: ‚ÄúWhatever Dharma‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gang zhig gi rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni chos so //
analyzed: gang zhig gi rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni chos so //
translated: The perfection of one‚Äôs own aim is Dharma.

original: @73b gnyi ga'i don phun sum tshogs pa ni des pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: @73b gnyi ga'i don phun sum tshogs pa ni des pa'i byang chub po //
translated: The perfection of both aims is the enlightenment of the bodhisattva.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni yon tan no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa ni yon tan no //
translated: The perfection of others‚Äô aims is virtue.

original: thob pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pas byang chub sems dpa' la dgos pa'i tshul khrims ltung ba med par bsrung ba de ni yon tan chos ldan 'byung 'gyur ba ni tshul khrims don no //
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pas byang chub sems dpa' la dgos pa'i tshul khrims ltung ba med par bsrung ba de ni yon tan chos ldan 'byung 'gyur ba ni tshul khrims don no //
translated: The meaning of morality is that morality, which is necessary for the bodhisattva, is protected without downfall, since it is the very cause of attaining the Dharma, enlightenment, and virtue.

original: yang gang zhig phan par byed pa'i chos dang byang chub yon tan yongs su nyams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni tshul khrims 'chal zhes bya bar 'brel te /
analyzed: yang gang zhig phan par byed pa'i chos dang byang chub yon tan yongs su nyams pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni tshul khrims 'chal zhes bya bar 'brel te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva who is losing the Dharma and the enlightenment that are beneficial is called ‚Äúimmoral.‚Äù

original: rnam par 'dren pas gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par 'dren pas gsungs so //
translated: The Guide has said this.

original: de bas na tshul khrims kho na la dang por gdams so zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims kho na la dang por gdams so zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, morality alone is the first instruction.

original: su zhig gis tshul khrims la gnas she na /
analyzed: su zhig gis tshul khrims la gnas she na /
translated: Who is it that abides in morality?

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If a bodhisattva, etc.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'jig rten du grags pa spyod kyang dkon mchog gsum la byang chub chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bar du skyabs su song ste /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'jig rten du grags pa spyod kyang dkon mchog gsum la byang chub chen po'i mthar thug pa'i bar du skyabs su song ste /
translated: If a bodhisattva practices the five sense objects renowned in the world, but goes for refuge to the Three Jewels until the end of great enlightenment,

original: 'gro ba la phan pa'i phyir bdag gis sangs rgyas thob par bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang yid la byed par gyur na /
analyzed: 'gro ba la phan pa'i phyir bdag gis sangs rgyas thob par bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang yid la byed par gyur na /
translated: and if he thinks ‚ÄúI will attain buddhahood in order to benefit migrating beings,‚Äù and if he keeps omniscience in mind,

original: de lta bu ni yang re zhig byang chub kyi sdom pa 'dzin pa'i phyir tshul khrims pha rol phyin gnas rig par bya ba ni shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni yang re zhig byang chub kyi sdom pa 'dzin pa'i phyir tshul khrims pha rol phyin gnas rig par bya ba ni shes par bya'o //
translated: Such a one should be known as abiding in the perfection of morality, because he or she holds the vow of enlightenment for a while.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo gzhan dag las byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo gzhan dag las byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs mod kyi /
translated: Although the morality of the vow of the bodhisattva, etc., is taught extensively in other Mahayana scriptures,

original: 'dir yang mdor bsdus nas bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang mdor bsdus nas bstan to //
translated: it is taught here in brief.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba ni tshul khrims nyams pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba ni tshul khrims nyams pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that one who is not separated from the mental orientation to omniscience has impaired morality,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te bskal pa bye bar srog gcod pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i las lam bcu spyod kyang dgra bcom rang rgyal nyid du yang tshul khrims bsngo zhing yid la 'dod pa skyed par byed na /
analyzed: gal te bskal pa bye bar srog gcod pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i las lam bcu spyod kyang dgra bcom rang rgyal nyid du yang tshul khrims bsngo zhing yid la 'dod pa skyed par byed na /
translated: If one, having practiced the ten paths of virtuous action such as abandoning killing for a million eons, dedicates his morality to the state of an arhat or pratyekabuddha, and generates the wish for it in his mind,

original: de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa dang ldan pas tshul khrims skyon byung ba dang de bzhin du ral bas tshul khrims nyams par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du tshul khrims nyams pa dang ldan pas tshul khrims skyon byung ba dang de bzhin du ral bas tshul khrims nyams par gyur pa yin no //
translated: At that time, as before, due to the degeneration of morality, the morality is impaired. Likewise, due to the tearing of the vows, the morality is impaired.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ni sangs rgyas nyid la spyan drangs nas de las slar log pas sems can bslus pa'i phyir phas pham pas kyang ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ni sangs rgyas nyid la spyan drangs nas de las slar log pas sems can bslus pa'i phyir phas pham pas kyang ste /
translated: Because of generating the mind of enlightenment, one invites the Buddhahood, and then turns away from it. Because of deceiving sentient beings, it is also a defeating offense.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung bas shin tu lci ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung bas shin tu lci ste /
translated: It is very heavy due to the root downfalls.

original: des nyan thos la sogs pa sems bskyed cing 'dod pa dang bcas par gyur @74a * //
analyzed: des nyan thos la sogs pa sems bskyed cing 'dod pa dang bcas par gyur @74a * //
translated: By that, the hearers and so forth generate the mind of enlightenment and become desirous.

original: pas so // yang dag par snang ba'i tshul khrims la ji ltar 'jug par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pas so // yang dag par snang ba'i tshul khrims la ji ltar 'jug par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach how to engage in the morality of the correct appearance,

original: tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúmorality,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims mnos pa bsrung zhing blangs nas so //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims mnos pa bsrung zhing blangs nas so //
translated: Having taken up the morality taught above, one should protect it.

original: snga ma bzhin du byang chub mchog tu yongs bsngo na /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du byang chub mchog tu yongs bsngo na /
translated: Having taken it up, and having dedicated it to supreme enlightenment, as before,

original: gang gi tshe tshul khrims de yis gzhan la mi smod cing rlom sems med cing bdag nyid kyi tshul khrims dka' thub kyi nga rgyal gyis bdag la stod par mi byed la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshul khrims de yis gzhan la mi smod cing rlom sems med cing bdag nyid kyi tshul khrims dka' thub kyi nga rgyal gyis bdag la stod par mi byed la /
translated: When, by means of that morality, one does not disparage others, is not conceited, and does not praise oneself with the pride of one‚Äôs own morality and austerity,

original: nga'i 'du shes len pa nyid dang / de bzhin du 'dor ba dang / sems can 'du shes yongs su spangs na /
analyzed: nga'i 'du shes len pa nyid dang / de bzhin du 'dor ba dang / sems can 'du shes yongs su spangs na /
translated: and when one abandons the notion of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and likewise the notion of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and also completely abandons the notion of sentient beings,

original: de'i tshe ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji skad bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas zhes brjod de /
translated: then at that time one is said to be a bodhisattva who abides in the perfection of morality, as it has been taught.

original: de bas na de ltar 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, one should engage in it in that way.

original: nyes pa gzhan dag kyang yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan dag kyang yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are other faults as well,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIf one is attached to morality, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i lam spyod pa ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims kyi lam yin pa'i phyir sems can 'di dag khrims ldan 'di dag khrims 'chal zhes dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i lam spyod pa ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims kyi lam yin pa'i phyir sems can 'di dag khrims ldan 'di dag khrims 'chal zhes dor bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed na /
translated: If the bodhisattva who practices the Victor‚Äôs path were to establish that some sentient beings are endowed with ethics and some are unethical, because the path of ethics is taught in that way,

original: de'i phyir sna tshogs 'du shes zhugs pa dngos por dmigs pa thams cad bsrung bar mi nus pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du mchog tu nyams shing yang de bzhin du tshul khrims ral bas na de nyid kyi phyir yongs dag tshul khrims med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sna tshogs 'du shes zhugs pa dngos por dmigs pa thams cad bsrung bar mi nus pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du mchog tu nyams shing yang de bzhin du tshul khrims ral bas na de nyid kyi phyir yongs dag tshul khrims med do //
translated: then, because of that, he would be extremely damaged as before, because he would not be able to protect all of the observances, since he would have entered into the perception of diversity and would be observing entities. And, as before, because his ethics would be torn, therefore, he would not have pure ethics.

original: de lta bas na dngos por dmigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos por dmigs par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not observe entities.

original: mi dmigs par spyod pa la ltung ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi dmigs par spyod pa la ltung ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that there is no downfall in practicing without observing,

original: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúFor one who has no perception of entities,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang la sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i stobs kyis bdag tu 'du shes med pas sems can gzhan du 'du shes med do //
analyzed: gang la sgyu ma lta bu'i chos nyid rtogs pa'i stobs kyis bdag tu 'du shes med pas sems can gzhan du 'du shes med do //
translated: Since he has no notion of self due to the power of realizing the reality of illusion-like phenomena, he has no notion of other sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi char 'byed pa med pas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan mar 'dzin pa las phyir phyogs pa dang ldan pas bkag pa'i dngos po la mi spyod pas sdom min ga la yod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi char 'byed pa med pas rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan mar 'dzin pa las phyir phyogs pa dang ldan pas bkag pa'i dngos po la mi spyod pas sdom min ga la yod de /
translated: For that very reason, since he is free from attachment and aversion due to the absence of the distinction of self and other, he is free from grasping at signs. Since he does not engage in prohibited things, how can he have non-restraint?

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang la sdom dang sdom pa ma yin rlom sems med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang la sdom dang sdom pa ma yin rlom sems med de /
translated: For that very reason, he has no conceit about restraint or non-restraint.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa skyon yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa skyon yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because holding morality and ritual to be supreme is a fault.

original: mi dge ba bskyed cing 'dzin pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa yang de @74b la med de /
analyzed: mi dge ba bskyed cing 'dzin pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa yang de @74b la med de /
translated: He also has no non-restraint that produces and holds non-virtue.

original: des ni mi dge ba las bzlog nas dge ba la zhugs pa'i phyir tshul khrims sdom par 'dren pas gsungs so //
analyzed: des ni mi dge ba las bzlog nas dge ba la zhugs pa'i phyir tshul khrims sdom par 'dren pas gsungs so //
translated: Because he has turned away from non-virtue and engaged in virtue, it is said that he is led to the restraint of morality.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa de nyid sbyin pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa de nyid sbyin pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one who possesses morality engages in generosity,

original: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúfor the sake of sentient beings,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang zhig bstan ma thag pa de ltar kun rdzob tu tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pas don dam par spros pa med pa'i phyir de lta bas na 'dzin pa med pas gang zhig sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i dngos po kun la lta ba med pa yin
analyzed: gang zhig bstan ma thag pa de ltar kun rdzob tu tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pas don dam par spros pa med pa'i phyir de lta bas na 'dzin pa med pas gang zhig sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i dngos po kun la lta ba med pa yin
translated: One who, as just described, possesses morality conventionally, since he is free of ultimate conceptual elaborations, therefore, since he is free of grasping, he is free of views regarding all things that are attractive or unattractive.

original: no // yang de nyid kyi phyir yan lag gi dam pa mgo la sogs pa gtong zhing zhum pa'i sems kyang med la /
analyzed: no // yang de nyid kyi phyir yan lag gi dam pa mgo la sogs pa gtong zhing zhum pa'i sems kyang med la /
translated: Moreover, for that very reason, he gives his head and so on, the best of limbs, and he is free of a faint heart.

original: dgos pa gtong ba ni bdog pa thams cad gtong zhing rtag tu sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa med pas na zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa gtong ba ni bdog pa thams cad gtong zhing rtag tu sbyin pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa med pas na zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: He is free of attachment because he gives everything he owns and he is always free of regard for the results of generosity.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po yongs su gtong ba med par ji ltar na thams cad gtong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po yongs su gtong ba med par ji ltar na thams cad gtong ba yin zhe na /
translated: How can one give everything without giving external things?

original: chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning All phenomena and so forth.

original: gang zhig dman pa la brtags pa sngon du 'gro bas nges pa'i don tha mal pa kun rdzob kyi rgyu dang 'brel pa las byung ba'i phyir yam brlar ro //
analyzed: gang zhig dman pa la brtags pa sngon du 'gro bas nges pa'i don tha mal pa kun rdzob kyi rgyu dang 'brel pa las byung ba'i phyir yam brlar ro //
translated: Since it arises from the connection with the cause and effect of the conventional, the ordinary definitive meaning is inferior, preceded by the examination of the inferior.

original: don dam par rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir bdag med par yang shes nas /
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir bdag med par yang shes nas /
translated: Having understood that ultimately, because of being free from intrinsic nature, there is no self,

original: gang gi tshe bdag gi sha yang gtong ba la zhum pa'i sems med na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gi sha yang gtong ba la zhum pa'i sems med na /
translated: when there is no shrinking mind even in giving away one's own flesh,

original: de tshe phyi rol dngos po gtong ba smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: de tshe phyi rol dngos po gtong ba smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: at that time, what need is there to mention giving away external things?

original: 'dir phyi rol gyi dngos po la ser sna byed pa de ni gnas med de mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dir phyi rol gyi dngos po la ser sna byed pa de ni gnas med de mi srid do //
translated: Here, that miserliness towards external things is not possible, it is impossible.

original: bdag med pa'i rnal 'byor pa ci'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnal 'byor pa ci'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug ce na /
translated: Why does the yogi/nƒ´ who is without self engage in generosity and so forth?

original: bdag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning If one thinks of self and so forth.

original: gal te bdag tu 'du shes nas dngos po la bdag gir 'dzin pas chags te /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu 'du shes nas dngos po la bdag gir 'dzin pas chags te /
translated: If one thinks of self and is attached through grasping things as mine,

original: yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i mun pas kun rdzob nyid la rmongs pa la gtong ba'i blo lta ga la yod /
analyzed: yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir dmigs pa'i mun pas kun rdzob nyid la rmongs pa la gtong ba'i blo lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be a thought of giving to those who are confused about the conventional due to the darkness of the obscuration of the object, because of the absence of the characteristic of giving?

original: de nyid kyi phyir ser sna can de dag ni yi dags gnas su skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ser sna can de dag ni yi dags gnas su skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: For that very reason, those who are miserly will be born in the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: brgya la ci ste mir skyes na yang de tshe dbul por 'gyur te 'thob bo //
analyzed: brgya la ci ste mir skyes na yang de tshe dbul por 'gyur te 'thob bo //
translated: And if they are born as humans, they will be poor.

original: yang de nyid kyi phyir ji skad bstan pa nyid kyi sbyin pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: yang de nyid kyi phyir ji skad bstan pa nyid kyi sbyin pa la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: For that very reason, one should engage in generosity as it has been taught.

original: ci'i phyir dang po sbyin pa kho na la mos par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dang po sbyin pa kho na la mos par byed ce na /
translated: Why does one first develop interest in generosity?

original: de tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says ‚Äúat that time,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe sems can dbul po mthong ba de'i tshe /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' snying rje phun sum tshogs pas ji skad bstan pa'i @75a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can dbul po mthong ba de'i tshe / byang chub sems dpa' snying rje phun sum tshogs pas ji skad bstan pa'i @75a * //
translated: When one sees poor sentient beings, at that time

original: sbyin pa la mos pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la mos pa dang ldan te /
translated: the bodhisattva, with perfect compassion, has interest in the generosity that has been taught.

original: lung la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang ldan pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang bcas pas thams cad gtong zhing rtag tu lhug par gtong ba dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lung la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang ldan pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang bcas pas thams cad gtong zhing rtag tu lhug par gtong ba dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: By being endowed with valid cognitions such as scripture, it is fruitful. Thus, one will always be generous and constantly endowed with openhandedness.

original: de'i tshe gling bzhi pa rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa ni rnam pa thams cad du 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir mchil ma'i thal ba 'dra /
analyzed: de'i tshe gling bzhi pa rin po che sna bdun gyis brgyan pa ni rnam pa thams cad du 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir mchil ma'i thal ba 'dra /
translated: At that time, the four continents adorned with the seven precious substances are like a drop of spit, because one is completely free of grasping.

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang ldan par byin nas de bzhin du dga' bar te yid bde ba thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang ldan par byin nas de bzhin du dga' bar te yid bde ba thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Having given with the purity of the three spheres, one will thus attain joy, mental satisfaction.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i gling thob pa ni de lta min no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i gling thob pa ni de lta min no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is not like attaining the continents as taught.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i sbyin pa mi zad par bya ba'i phyir ched du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i sbyin pa mi zad par bya ba'i phyir ched du bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that one should dedicate to unsurpassable enlightenment the generosity taught above in order to make it inexhaustible,

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the line ‚ÄúThe wise one should dedicate generosity to enlightenment‚Äù is stated.

original: bstan ma thag pa'i rim pas sbyin pa byin te /
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i rim pas sbyin pa byin te /
translated: Having given generosity by the process just taught,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa gsal ba srid pa gsum gyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag kun la sbyin pa 'di byin par gyur cig snyam du de lta bu'i bsam pas sbyin pa byin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa gsal ba srid pa gsum gyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag kun la sbyin pa 'di byin par gyur cig snyam du de lta bu'i bsam pas sbyin pa byin la /
translated: The wise bodhisattva, being clear, gives this gift with the thought, ‚ÄúMay it go to all the sentient beings in the three worlds.‚Äù

original: de yang 'gro ba'i don nyid kyi phyir byang chub mchog tu yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: de yang 'gro ba'i don nyid kyi phyir byang chub mchog tu yongs su bsngo na /
translated: And if he dedicates it to supreme enlightenment for the sake of the welfare of the world,

original: byang chub dang sems can mi zad pa'i sbyin pa zad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: byang chub dang sems can mi zad pa'i sbyin pa zad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: then that inexhaustible gift of enlightenment and sentient beings will not be exhausted.

original: de yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'i 'bras bu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mngon par zhen pa med pa'i 'bras bu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And in order to realize the result of that without attachment,

original: sbyin pa byin nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩsbyin par byed pa dang / sbyin pa dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po la gnas par byed pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sbyin par byed pa dang / sbyin pa dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po la gnas par byed pa med do //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHaving given a gift,‚Äù etc.üîΩThat which is the non-apprehension of the giver, the gift, and the recipient is the non-apprehension of the gift.

original: sbyin pa byin pa yang pha rol rjes su bzung ba'i blos yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa yang pha rol rjes su bzung ba'i blos yin gyi /
translated: And having given a gift, he should not apprehend the gift, the giver, or the recipient.

original: de ni nam du yang 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa la re ba med do //
analyzed: de ni nam du yang 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa la re ba med do //
translated: He never hopes for the ripening of the result that is desired.

original: de ltar 'bras bu dang bcas par rang la ji snyed bdog pa gtong bar 'gyur ba ni mkhas pa thams cad stong pa ste chung du btang ba la yang thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis grangs med dpag tu med pa ste yongs su bcad par mi nus pa'i
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu dang bcas par rang la ji snyed bdog pa gtong bar 'gyur ba ni mkhas pa thams cad stong pa ste chung du btang ba la yang thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis grangs med dpag tu med pa ste yongs su bcad par mi nus pa'i
translated: Thus, the wise one gives away all that he has, together with the result, and even a small gift, due to the power of skill in means, becomes immeasurable and incalculable, because it cannot be measured.

original: phyir dpag tu med pa'i rnam par smin pa thob pa 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: phyir dpag tu med pa'i rnam par smin pa thob pa 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is understood: he obtains an immeasurable ripening.

original: gang ser sna tshar bcad pa dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin du rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro bas yongs su bsngo ba la goms par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang ser sna tshar bcad pa dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin du rjes su yi rang ba sngon du 'gro bas yongs su bsngo ba la goms par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should practice dedication preceded by rejoicing, just as one conquers stinginess and perfects generosity,

original: srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says the three existences, etc.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid ni srid pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i mtshan nyid ni srid pa gsum mo //
translated: The three existences are characterized by the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: de dag na sems can ma lus ji snyed @75b pa thams cad nam mkha'i khams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ma lus pa ste srid pa'o //
analyzed: de dag na sems can ma lus ji snyed @75b pa thams cad nam mkha'i khams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ma lus pa ste srid pa'o //
translated: All sentient beings without exception are included in the realm of space.

original: yang de dag thams cad kyis 'jig rten mkhyen pa sangs rgyas dang / rang rgyal dgra bcom la bskal pa mtha' yas par sbyin pa byin /
analyzed: yang de dag thams cad kyis 'jig rten mkhyen pa sangs rgyas dang / rang rgyal dgra bcom la bskal pa mtha' yas par sbyin pa byin /
translated: Moreover, all of them give gifts to the world-knowers, the Buddhas, the Solitary Realizers, and the Arhats for limitless eons.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos legs tshol na ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos legs tshol na ste /
translated: In the same way, they give gifts to the Listeners who are seeking virtue.

original: nyan thos kyi yon tan 'dod cing zhes bya bas ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi yon tan 'dod cing zhes bya bas ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The phrase who desire the virtues of the Listeners is a synecdoche.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan yang ngo //
translated: The virtues of the Buddhas and so on are also included.

original: dngos por dmigs pa dang ldan pas zhugs pa'i phyir yongs su rtag pa bzung nas gnas na zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dngos por dmigs pa dang ldan pas zhugs pa'i phyir yongs su rtag pa bzung nas gnas na zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that if they were to take up and maintain a thorough dedication that is associated with the observation of real things, they would be engaging in a dedication that is based on the notion of real things.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa gzhan gang zhig gis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas pa yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa gzhan gang zhig gis /
translated: What other wise bodhisattvas, who are skilled in the true methods,

original: de dag gi bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la yi rangs nas sems can don du ste /
analyzed: de dag gi bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la yi rangs nas sems can don du ste /
translated: rejoice in those bases of meritorious action and dedicate them to the goal of sentient beings?

original: rgyur byang chub mchog tu yongs bsngo na /
analyzed: rgyur byang chub mchog tu yongs bsngo na /
translated: If one dedicates to supreme enlightenment,

original: 'di ltar des ser sna tshar bcad nas ji skad bstan pas 'gro ba thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: 'di ltar des ser sna tshar bcad nas ji skad bstan pas 'gro ba thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: in this way, having overcome stinginess, one surpasses all beings in the way that has been taught.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i yongs su bsngo bas yongs su sngo bar byed pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i yongs su bsngo bas yongs su sngo bar byed pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand the dedication in the way that it has been taught,

original: nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says the jewel, etc.

original: dper na nor bu mching bu'i phung po chen por gyur pa dang / rin po che bee d'u rya gcig gis de kun rin thang mthu che ba'i phyir zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: dper na nor bu mching bu'i phung po chen por gyur pa dang / rin po che bee d'u rya gcig gis de kun rin thang mthu che ba'i phyir zil gyis gnon to //
translated: For example, a great mass of glass is surpassed by a single beryl jewel, because of the great value of that.

original: de bzhin du 'gro kun sbyin pa'i phung po rgya chen kun rjes su yi rang bsngo na du 'gro ba bstan ma thag pa'i rim pas yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro kun sbyin pa'i phung po rgya chen kun rjes su yi rang bsngo na du 'gro ba bstan ma thag pa'i rim pas yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad zil gyis gnon ro //
translated: In the same way, if one rejoices in and dedicates all the great masses of generosity of all beings, one surpasses all those bodhisattvas who dedicate in the way that has just been taught.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis rgya cher bstan nas de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la gdams pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis rgya cher bstan nas de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la gdams pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the two perfections extensively, in order to teach the instruction for the remaining perfections,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma yongs su skyong zhing ster ba na 'gro ba dang 'brel par sbyin pa byin nas de dag nyid yongs su skyong ba na de la byed pa por mi dmigs pas na bdag gir mi byed la
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma yongs su skyong zhing ster ba na 'gro ba dang 'brel par sbyin pa byin nas de dag nyid yongs su skyong ba na de la byed pa por mi dmigs pas na bdag gir mi byed la
translated: If the bodhisattva is protecting and giving the remaining perfections, and giving gifts related to going, when he protects them, he does not make them his own, since he does not observe an agent.

original: / bya ba'i las su yang mi rtog la /
analyzed: / bya ba'i las su yang mi rtog la /
translated: He does not conceive of an object of action.

original: dngos po la yang phangs pa med na /
analyzed: dngos po la yang phangs pa med na /
translated: And if he has no regard for things,

original: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba mthu chen 'phel 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba mthu chen 'phel 'gyur te /
translated: then the roots of virtue will increase greatly,üîΩlike the moon in the bright half of the month, shining with unclouded light.

original: sprin med 'od ldan zla dkyil yar gyi ngo bzhin no zhes bya ba des ni pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma la gdams pas don ma lus pa la gdams pa yin te /
analyzed: sprin med 'od ldan zla dkyil yar gyi ngo bzhin no zhes bya ba des ni pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma la gdams pas don ma lus pa la gdams pa yin te /
translated: This teaches the remaining perfections, and so teaches the entire meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags pa bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩyon tan rin po che sdud pa @76a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos 'phags pa bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bya ba yin par rig par bya'o // yon tan rin po che sdud pa @76a * //
translated: One should understand that the spiritual teacher's work is like that of the bodhisattva Sublime Wisdom.üîΩThe Chapter on Sublime Wisdom, the thirty-first chapter of the Precious

original: tshigs su bcad pa las chos 'phags kyi le'u ste sum cu rtsa gcig pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las chos 'phags kyi le'u ste sum cu rtsa gcig pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: Garland, a commentary on the discipline of the Bodhisattvas.

original: // / de lta bu'i gdams ngag thob pa la sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gtso cher lhag par bya ba rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / de lta bu'i gdams ngag thob pa la sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gtso cher lhag par bya ba rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having received such instructions, one should attain the stages of the Joyous and so forth by the process of arousing the Thought of Enlightenment and so forth. In order to understand the principal practice of the perfections such as generosity,

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, The bodhisattva, having attained the stage of Joyous, should practice generosity.

original: de la re zhig sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas gtso cher bya ba ni ser sna spangs nas sbyin pas rnam pa thams cad du yi dags su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid sems can thams cad kyi ser sna gcod do //
analyzed: de la re zhig sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas gtso cher bya ba ni ser sna spangs nas sbyin pas rnam pa thams cad du yi dags su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid sems can thams cad kyi ser sna gcod do //
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva who is on the first stage, the Joyous, should practice generosity, having abandoned stinginess, and in every way cut the stinginess of all sentient beings, who are of the nature of pretas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du dbul ba dang ni ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du dbul ba dang ni ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is like that, in that he cuts off and removes poverty,

original: de bzhin du 'brel ba'i sred pa dang / mi khom pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod cing sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'brel ba'i sred pa dang / mi khom pa dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod cing sel bar byed do //
translated: and likewise, the craving for connection, the unfavorable, suffering, and so on, and all the afflictions.

original: longs spyod kyi rnam pa'i bye brag mtha' yas rgyas pa ni rgya che ba thob nas byang chub sems dpa' spyad pa spyod par byed de /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi rnam pa'i bye brag mtha' yas rgyas pa ni rgya che ba thob nas byang chub sems dpa' spyad pa spyod par byed de /
translated: Having attained the vast, the bodhisattva practices the perfections, the varieties of which are infinite.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can sbyin pas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la bkod nas smin par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can sbyin pas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la bkod nas smin par byed do //
translated: Having established suffering sentient beings in the generation of the thought of enlightenment and so on by means of generosity, he brings them to maturity.

original: de bzhin du dri ma med pa la gnas pas ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'i skyon thams cad dang bral bas ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims kyis dud 'gro'i 'gro ba du ma sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can gyi ngo bo dang / mi khom pa brgyad spong bar byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du dri ma med pa la gnas pas ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'i skyon thams cad dang bral bas ji skad bstan pa'i tshul khrims kyis dud 'gro'i 'gro ba du ma sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can gyi ngo bo dang / mi khom pa brgyad spong bar byed cing /
translated: Likewise, the one who is in the stage of the stainless, by means of the morality taught, removes all the faults of immorality, and removes the many various forms of the animal realm, and the eight unfavorable states.

original: de yis mi nyid la sogs pa dal 'byor khyad par can gyi don byed pa rtag tu rnyed do //
analyzed: de yis mi nyid la sogs pa dal 'byor khyad par can gyi don byed pa rtag tu rnyed do //
translated: He always obtains the meaning of the special freedoms and endowments of being a human being, etc.

original: 'od byed pa la gnas pas ni gnod sems thams cad bral ba'i bzod pas gzugs bzang ste mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od byed pa la gnas pas ni gnod sems thams cad bral ba'i bzod pas gzugs bzang ste mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who abides in the Luminous, by means of the patience free from all malice, obtains a good form, because it is adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: dam pa ni mchog go //
analyzed: dam pa ni mchog go //
translated: The best is the supreme.

original: rgya chen ni yangs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen ni yangs pa'o //
translated: The vast is the extensive.

original: thob par 'gyur te gser dang 'dra ba'i phyir gser mdog yid du 'ong ba'i phyir sdug pa'o //
analyzed: thob par 'gyur te gser dang 'dra ba'i phyir gser mdog yid du 'ong ba'i phyir sdug pa'o //
translated: He obtains the golden color, because it is like gold, and the beauty, because it is pleasing.

original: lta bas chog mi shes pa'i phyir 'gro bas lta ba'i 'os su 'gyur ba'o //üîΩ'od 'phro ba la gnas pas ni le lo thams cad dang bral ba'i brtson 'grus kyi ni dkar po'i yon tan 'grib mi 'gyur te /üîΩye shes kyi yul mtha' yas pas na mtha' yas te /
analyzed: lta bas chog mi shes pa'i phyir 'gro bas lta ba'i 'os su 'gyur ba'o // 'od 'phro ba la gnas pas ni le lo thams cad dang bral ba'i brtson 'grus kyi ni dkar po'i yon tan 'grib mi 'gyur te / ye shes kyi yul mtha' yas pas na mtha' yas te /
translated: He becomes the object of the world's gaze, because the world never tires of looking at him.üîΩThe one who abides in the Radiant, by means of the effort free from all laziness, obtains the accumulation of the best wealth of the victors, because he is the very embodiment of the accumulation of the best wealth of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi nor mchog bsags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyal ba'i bang mdzod rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi nor mchog bsags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rgyal ba'i bang mdzod rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who abides in the Difficult to Conquer, by means of the meditation that is difficult to master, obtains the inexhaustible good qualities, because the domain of his pristine wisdom is infinite.

original: sbyangs dka' ba la gnas pas ni rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad spangs pa'i bsam gtan gyis ni 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam par g-yeng @76b ba'i rgyur gyur pas nyes pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir smad pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su 'dor bar byed cing
analyzed: sbyangs dka' ba la gnas pas ni rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad spangs pa'i bsam gtan gyis ni 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam par g-yeng @76b ba'i rgyur gyur pas nyes pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir smad pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su 'dor bar byed cing
translated: One who abides in the difficult to overcome stage completely abandons all forms of contempt, because meditative concentration that abandons all distraction is contemptible, since the qualities of the desire realm are a cause of distraction.

original: / khyad par can gyi bden pa rtogs pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rigs dang mngon par shes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: / khyad par can gyi bden pa rtogs pa dang / mngon par shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rigs dang mngon par shes pa dang ngo //
translated: And because it is the realization of the special truth and the nature of the superknowledges, it is respectively the lineage and the superknowledge.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin skyed par byed pa'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the actual basis because it generates the meditative stabilization of the heroic stride and so on.

original: mngon du gyur pa la gnas pas ni shes rab 'chal pa thams cad spangs nas shes rab kyis ni chos kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su shes nas /
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa la gnas pas ni shes rab 'chal pa thams cad spangs nas shes rab kyis ni chos kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma lta bu nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su shes nas /
translated: One who abides in the manifest stage completely abandons all forms of incorrect knowledge, because wisdom completely knows the nature of phenomena, such as the illusion like nature and so on.

analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ngan song dang phyin ci log gis bcings pa de rnams ma lus pa las yang dag 'da' bar 'gyur te /

translated: In this way, first of all, in a place that has been made pleasing, the Blessed One, the King of the ≈öƒÅkyas, seated on a lion throne, turning the wheel of Dharma, endowed with the mudrƒÅ, is worshipped just as it is.

analyzed: de nas mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi gnas skabs dbye ba'i grangs rtsi ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i rang bzhin so sor nges par 'jal ba dang / sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa med par dpyod pa dang / mngon sum dang rjes su @77b dpag pa'i tshad mas brtags pa'i phyir so sor rtog pa nyid do //
translated: Then, one should analyze the enumeration of the divisions of the eight topics of realization, the individual ascertainment of the nature of the topics of realization, the analysis without superimposition or denial, and the discernment by means of the valid cognitions of direct perception and inference.

analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam par dpyad pa nyid kyi don mtshan ma la dmigs pa rtsa ba'i sems su bsdus pa'i sems kyis bcug nas /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la 'dud pa ni 'dun pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind of aspiration is the mind that aspires to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

translated: The mind of nonconceptuality is the mind that does not conceive of all phenomena as illusion-like through the light of correct wisdom, due to the absence of seeing with the eye of wisdom.

original: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa nyid do //

original: de yang rang dang spyi'i mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang dang spyi'i mtshan ma med pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: It is signlessness because it is devoid of the signs of own-being and the signs of the object.

original: des don du gnyer bar bya ba'i dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir smon pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: des don du gnyer bar bya ba'i dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir smon pa med pa nyid do //

analyzed: yang de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam par grol ba'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin to //

analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin la le lo dang / dmigs pa la brjed pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / mi rtsol ba dang / rtsol ches pa dang / skyon drug po de dag gnas skabs ji lta bas skyes pa na de'i gnyen po 'du byed brgyad ji lta ba bzhin du bsten par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the six faults of samƒÅdhi are laziness, forgetting the instruction, laxity, excitation, lack of application, and excessive application. When these six faults arise in whatever circumstances, one should rely on the eight applications that are their antidotes.

analyzed: shes bzhin ni bying rgod kyi gnyen po ste /
